abstracts.cdata!:
The Financial Sector Technical
            Assistance Project will complement the Government's
            reform program by strengthening the capabilities of the
            Central Bank to manage financial and monetary developments
            and will assist in the training of bank managers and staff.
            Specifically, the credit will finance consultants'
            services, training, civil works and equipment for the
            following components: (i) overseas and local training of the
            Central Bank's Banking Supervision staff; (ii)
            assistance in auditing troubled institutions, and in
            developing and implementing action programs for these
            institutions; (iii) advice to the Governor of the Central
            Bank on monetary policy issues, particularly the
            establishment of a reserve money management system and
            improving the monitoring and forecasting of monetary
            developments; and (iv) financing for the foreign exchange
            costs of constructing residential training facilities near Nairobi.
